intro: Myrsine myrtillus, commonly known as the small-leaved myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are edible. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
